alert.note: Alert for Central Colorado River Basin; Elkhead and Park Mountains; Flat Tops; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys; Upper Yampa River Basin (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 12:28PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Eagle and southeastern Routt Counties through 100 PM MDT... At 1227 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles south of Yampa, or 38 miles northeast of Glenwood Springs, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Mc Coy, Bond and Toponas. This includes the following highways... Colorado 131 between mile markers 17 and 39. Colorado 134 between mile markers 1 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Colorado River Basin; Elkhead and Park Mountains; Flat Tops; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys; Upper Yampa River Basin
